intro: Dombeya scabrida var. helvola, commonly known as the rough dombeya, is a deciduous shrub native to southern Africa. It features simple, ovate to elliptic leaves that are covered in fine, stiff hairs, giving them a rough texture. The plant produces showy, fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in terminal clusters. These flowers bloom in spring and are often visited by bees and other pollinators. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
